chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zeuntre T Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (28 pages) commencing 12/04/2014 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
/Commuting Extended Supervision Term, signed and filed.  Copy sent to the District Attorney's Office and Department of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis P. Moroney, Br. 20, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify extended supervision term.

Defendant Zeuntre T Robinson in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Zeuntre T Robinson in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS/ and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARSS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 232 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Restitution set at $65.00 payable to John T..  Restitution is to be paid at 25% prison funds with any balance to be paid during extended supervion.  Failure to pay will reult in the entry of a civil judgement

-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during extended supervision  ; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
--Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with John T. or his residence or place of employment / eD NW.,his residence or place of employment
Court ordered the defendsant remanded.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Louis E. Epps in court, defendant Zeuntre T Robinson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel in other courts and due to this court's calendar, case is adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment, received and filed.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  State requested an adjournment of the sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 on 10/29/14 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Zeuntre T Robinson in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Zeuntre T Robinson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, charging the defendant as follows:
Robbery (Threat of Force), a Class E Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.32(1)(b).
Branch 20 not in session on 8/22/14.  Case is rescheduled for plea AND sentencing before Branch 20 on 9/19/14 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Zeuntre T Robinson not in court, defendant in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Epps contacted the Court to obtain a new date; he is out ill and he will not be in tomrorrow.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis E Epps in court, defendant Zeuntre T Robinson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Schoepp in trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis E Epps in court via telephone, defendant Zeuntre T Robinson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Louis E Epps in court, defendant Zeuntre T Robinson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date; file retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis E Epps in court, defendant Zeuntre T Robinson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties requested another scheduling date.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Zeuntre T Robinson in court with attorney Steve Sargent for Louis E Epps.  Defendant Zeuntre T Robinson in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Zeuntre T Robinson in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Zeuntre T Robinson in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
